newsitem.title: USA: PdVSA nears deal to buy 50 pct of Hess plant.
newsitem.headline: PdVSA nears deal to buy 50 pct of Hess plant.

text.p: State-owned Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA) is near to completing a deal with Amerada Hess for a 50 percent stake in its large refinery on St. Croix in the U.S. Virgin Islands, a PDVSA source said.
Under the terms of the deal PDVSA, through one of its operating companies, would have the option to buy the remaining 50 percent of the plant within two years, the source said.
An Amerada spokesman declined to comment on the details of the deal.
PDVSA will pay $500 million to $600 million for its initial stake and the deal, although the exact amount is still under discussion, the source said.

"We've said publicly that we are looking for a joint-venture partner," said the Hess spokesman. Hess also has said it is leaning toward some kind of alliance with a South American partner, though it has not identified Venezuela.

Nevertheless, a PDVSA source said in March that its subsidiary Corpoven was conducting a feasability study on some sort of link to either supply crude to the refinery, lease the plant or take an equity stake.
